item.title: Why Epic Is Bringing The Late Juice WRLD To Fortnite
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/why-epic-is-bringing-the-late-juice-wrld-to-fortnite/1100-6527957/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

When the Fortnite Chapter 5 and Remix Finale event takes the stage in-game on November 30, it will feature a pack of four iconic musical artists: Snoop Dogg, Eminem, Ice Spice, and Juice WRLD. Like previous in-game concerts, such as those starring Travis Scott and Ariana Grande, the event is likely to be a kaleidoscopic audiovisual roller coaster. Still, by including the late Juice WRLD, who passed away in 2019, this in-game concert will also be decidedly different from any before seen in Fortnite: It will be the first to use an artist's likeness posthumously, something that Hollywood is also grappling with as of late.

GameSpot recently spoke to Nate Nanzer, Epic's head of global partnerships, in a music-focused interview that hit on the developer-publisher's decision to bring Juice WRLD, whose real name is Jarad Anthony Higgins, to Fortnite. Nanzer told me Epic had long hoped to do something like this with the late artist and explained why the company feels now is the right time.

"It's something that our players have been asking for for years and years and years, and we've wanted to do it, but we wanted to find the right moment," Nanzer said. "We obviously want to do it in the most respectful way possible. We worked very closely with his mom and his label, and we were able to find the right moment where it felt right, around this event, and he has new music coming out, so all the stars kind of aligned around this moment."

Nanzer mentioned that Juice WRLD himself was "a big Fortnite player," and though the Epic executive didn't say this, it stands to reason that Juice WRLD would want to be in the game if he could say so today. Still, even with the involvement of his family and his music label, for some, the inclusion of a deceased artist's likeness in this manner may always cross a line. In the movie world, Robert Downey Jr. recently said he plans to sue anyone who tries to create an AI replica of his likeness, and that even if it were to occur after he has died, his "law firm will still be very active." Events in 2012 surely predate many of Fortnite's biggest fans, but the Juice WRLD concert also recalls the Tupac "hologram" that once performed at Coachella.

In the Fortnite world, I haven't personally seen a lot of pushback to Juice WRLD's involvement in next weekend's event. Certainly, there have been some feelings of ethics-based squeamishness, but the prevailing sentiment on places like the game's subreddit and popular Discord servers is one of excitement, perhaps owing to the often younger player pool in Fortnite. Whereas older players and onlookers may see this as a line being crossed, younger players who have already spent years growing up within Fortnite may more quickly accept this as a marvel of modern technology, and they may be excited to finally have the Fortnite Juice WRLD event Nanzer says has been one of the community's most requested.

"Our community loves his music. We have data [that shows he is] still extremely popular. And I would say, I can't quantify this, but when I look at Reddit threads, or Discord chats, or Twitter threads, Juice WRLD comes up over and over and over again. I mean, people have made Juice WRLD concerts in Fortnite Creative and [Unreal Engine for Fortnite]."

Nanzer added that he feels fans of the late artist will come out of the event with positive feelings. "We're hopeful. We know our players have been asking for it, so there's a lot of pressure to really deliver it the right way. I think people are really gonna love what we have coming, like, I think it's done in an awesome way. I think if you're a Juice WRLD fan, you're gonna feel good about it," he said.

As mentioned, Juice WRLD's mother, Carmela Wallace, was involved in this collaboration. Earlier this month, she shared remarks on the upcoming event, which you can read in full below.

"Jarad always loved to play Fortnite - it was more than just entertainment for him, it was a way to connect with others. From a young age, video games were a part of how he bonded with friends and family, and being in Fortnite is an incredible tribute to that connection. I know he would be overjoyed to see how his love for games continues to bring people together across different spaces, just like his music does.‚Äù

The debate over when it is or isn't acceptable to use a deceased person's likeness won't end when Fortnite Chapter 5 does next weekend, but Nanzer told me the company wants "music to permeate everything in Fortnite," which likely means this isn't the last time Fortnite will court controversy, even unintentionally, as it strives to fulfill its vision of a multimedia metaverse. In fact, there are already rumors that a future Fortnite collaboration will revolve around XXXTentacion, a musical artist who was murdered in 2018 at the age of 20.

Fortnite is a tastemaker on a global scale. Much of the games industry over the past half-decade has been mired in chasing lucrative trends that Fortnite started or had massive success with. Once meant to be nothing more than a survival game, Fortnite is today an increasingly hard-to-define platform that doesn't merely feature pop culture; it shapes it. As Epic continues down this path of making the ultimate everything experience, it's inevitably molding what the future looks like, whether we're ready to live there or not.

Editor's note: Remarks from Mrs. Wallace were added to the body of this story shortly after publishing.

Mark Delaney on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth Drops To Lowest Price Yet For Black Friday
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/final-fantasy-7-rebirth-drops-to-lowest-price-yet-for-black-friday/1100-6527845/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Fresh off its Game of the Year nomination at The Game Awards, Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth is on sale for its lowest price yet for Black Friday. Normally $70, Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth is discounted to only $40. The massive $30 price cut is available at Amazon and Best Buy, and you'll get a cool freebie with if you snag a copy from Amazon before it sells out. Amazon also has the official Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth soundtrack box set for 15% off during its Black Friday sale.

Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth - Amazon-Exclusive Edition

$40 (was $70)

If you buy Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth from Amazon, you'll get an exclusive DualSense controller skin. We wouldn't be surprised if this deal sells out, but Best Buy also has Rebirth for $30 off.

The second chapter in the Final Fantasy 7 remake trilogy, Rebirth sees the main cast of heroes venture out of Midgar and into a larger world. While there are some narrative stumbles along the way, Rebirth does a superb job in fine-tuning its gameplay to feel even more satisfying, is a treat for the eyes with its impressive graphics, and sets the stage for a grand finale currently in development.

Fans can also save big on several other entries in the Final Fantasy franchise. Most notably, Final Fantasy I-VI Collection Anniversary Edition is on sale for $20 off on Nintendo Switch and PS4 at Amazon and Best Buy. Released last month, the Anniversary Edition comes with all six Pixel Remasters and a sticker sheet with sprite art. Meanwhile, Crisis Core: Final Fantasy 7 Reunion is up for grabs for only $20. A remake of a pretty great PSP game, Crisis Core serves as a prequel to the main events of the original Final Fantasy 7 for PS1. And if you haven't picked up Final Fantasy 16, which features fast-paced action sequences against a gorgeous high-fantasy backdrop, it's available for only $25.

Final Fantasy: Black Friday Game Deals

  • Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth (PS5) -- $40 ($70)
  • Final Fantasy 16 (PS5) -- $25 ($50)
  • Final Fantasy I-VI Collection Anniversary Edition (Switch) -- $55 ($75)
  • Final Fantasy I-VI Collection Anniversary Edition (PS4) -- $55 ($75)
  • Crisis Core: Final Fantasy 7 Reunion (PS5) -- $20 ($30)
  • Crisis Core: Final Fantasy 7 Reunion (Xbox) -- $20 ($30)

Square Enix JRPG Deals at Amazon

Final Fantasy isn't the only Square Enix franchise with discounted games for Black Friday. Amazon has great deals on a bunch of Square Enix RPGs for PS5, Xbox Series X, and Nintendo Switch. Some of the highlights include Visions of Mana for $45--the first discount for the recently released RPG--and a lovely pair of games with HD-2D graphics: Octopath Traveler 2 and Star Ocean: The Second Story R. Both games are available for 50% off or more. Meanwhile, Nintendo Switch users can save 50% on Dragon Quest Monsters: The Dark Prince.

  • Dragon Quest Monsters: The Dark Prince (Switch) -- $30 ($60)
  • Octopath Traveler 2 (PS5 / Switch) -- $25 ($60)
  • Star Ocean: The Second Story R (PS5) -- $20 ($50)
  • Star Ocean: The Second Story R (Switch) -- $30 ($50)
  • Visions of Mana (PS5 / Xbox) -- $45 ($60)

Atlus JRPG Deals at Amazon

JRPGs by Atlus are also included in Black Friday sales. Most notably, Metaphor: ReFantazio is on sale for the first time for PS5 and Xbox Series X.

  • Metaphor: ReFantazio (PS5 / Xbox) -- $50 ($70)
  • Persona 3 Reload (PS5 / PS4) -- $25 ($70)
  • Persona 5 Royal (PS5) -- $20 ($40)
  • Persona 5 Royal (Switch) -- $25 ($60)
  • Shin Megami Tensei V: Vengeance (PS5 / Switch) -- $25 ($60)
  • Shin Megami Tensei V: Vengeance Steelbook Edition (Xbox) -- $25 ($60)

Shop Black Friday Gaming Deals at Amazon:

  • Nintendo Switch
  • PlayStation
  • Xbox
  • PC Accessories | PC Hardware

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Tons Of Digital Switch Games Are Discounted For Black Friday
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/tons-of-digital-switch-games-are-discounted-for-black-friday/1100-6527952/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Best Buy‚Äôs Black Friday event is officially here, and it‚Äôs slashing prices on dozens of digital Switch games. Many of these are also on sale on the official Nintendo eShop, but buying from Best Buy is the better option as you‚Äôll get the full Gold Points for your purchase, whereas the eShop gives you an amount based on the discounted price. That means Best Buy is the best place to shop for digital Switch games this Black Friday, and there are some great options to choose from.

Arguably the best game on sale is The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom. It was Nintendo‚Äôs first $70 game when it was released in 2023, but right now you can pick it up for just $50. You‚Äôll find hours of fun in its expansive open world, and the brilliant Ultrahand mechanic makes it easy to craft unique gadgets to help you zoom across its landscape or battle its most challenging enemies. At just $50, we can‚Äôt recommend it enough.

You won‚Äôt find the newly released Dragon Quest 3 HD-2D Remake on sale, but two other Dragon Quest games are down to some of their best prices of the year. Dragon Quest 11 S: Echoes of an Elusive Age is now $35 (was $50), offering a traditional console RPG experience with a surprisingly moving story and memorable cast, and it‚Äôs a great value at this discounted price. For something a bit different, you‚Äôll find Dragon Quest Builders 2 for $35 (was $50).

Other notable deals include Doom Eternal Deluxe Editiion for $17.50 (was $70), Persona 5 Royal for $15 (was $60), and Super Monkey Ball: Banana Rumble for $25 (was $70). Plenty of other great digital Switch games from beloved series like Super Mario, Sonic the Hedgehog, Xenoblade Chronicles, and more are on sale for Black Friday, and you‚Äôll find the best deals below. Note that some prices won't show up until you add the digital code to your shopping cart, but you can review the sale prices before checkout.

Done perusing Best Buy's Black Friday event? Head over to our Black Friday Hub, which aggregates all the latest price cuts on video games, electronics, collectibles, and more. Check back frequently, as new discounts are added daily.

item.title: Destiny 2's Iron Banner Returns Soon With A Brand-New Armor Set And Rocket Sidearm
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/destiny-2s-iron-banner-returns-soon-with-a-brand-new-armor-set-and-rocket-sidearm/1100-6527954/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

It's a perfect time for Iron Wolves to be thankful as Destiny 2's Iron Banner event will make its return next week. The Iron Banner usually brings along new weapons and ornaments, and this event will be no different as it introduces both a new armor set and rocket sidearm into the the loot pool.

On Bungie's This Week In Destiny announcements, the name of the armor set was revealed--Iron Intent--with pieces "worthy of Weyloran, Nirwen, and Orewig" themselves. Players will know those names as great Iron Lords, who've all had weapons and ornaments named after them throughout the years. The Iron Banner will return to the game starting on November 26, with the match type of Control for the first week.

The armor has a Norse-adjacent aesthetic with the Titan helmet almost looking like a hammer with the Warlock mask having studded horns. All three have intricate braiding embossing up and down the plates. Destiny has had similar ornaments before with the Valhund set, but still very different in presentation.

Along with the Iron Intent set, the announcement teased the first-ever Stasis rocket sidearm. It also revealed that it would be possible to get the weapon with the Loose Change perk with Chill Clip perks. As Iron Banner events are now two weeks long, there's plenty of time to get the perfect roll on the new weapon. The few rocket sidearms in the game have proven to be excellent, and the current Artifact has a lot of Stasis weapon-centric perks, so it should be a pretty desirable weapon.

The previous Iron Banner brought new versions of old favorites, the Claws of the Wolf pulse rifle and Crimil's Dagger hand cannon. This will be the last time the banner is raised and Lord Saladin's sigil is lit during this episode, and if you missed out, it's a great time to make your enemies hear the howls and know fear.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Black Friday 2024 ‚Äì Huge Savings on the Xbox Series X and Controllers
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/black-friday-2024-huge-savings-on-the-xbox-series-x-and-controllers/1100-6527940/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Black Friday 2024 is here, and gaming fans, it‚Äôs time to get excited.

This is paid content. It was written and produced in collaboration with the sponsor.

Black Friday 2024 has officially kicked off, and while the deals for this year's biggest shopping event are rolling in, we've already spotted some standout discounts on the Xbox Series X console and fan-favorite Xbox Wireless Controllers. If you've been keen to upgrade your gaming setup, but don't quite have the budget, now is your time to strike. The Xbox Series X 1TB Carbon Black will bring some serious firepower to your kit. With lightning-fast load times, up to 120 FPS gameplay, and exclusive perks like Quick Resume and Xbox Velocity Architecture, it's a powerhouse designed to take your gaming to the next level.

Pair your Xbox purchase with one of the many Xbox Game Pass options available, and you've got yourself a gateway to an ever-expanding library of games--including day one releases. From Game Pass Core, perfect for casual and online gamers, to Game Pass Ultimate, which opens up cloud gaming and the best of Xbox, there's an option for every type of player. Already own an Xbox Series X or S? There are still great deals for you, too. Xbox Wireless Controllers are on sale in multiple colors, from the classic Carbon Black to the eye-catching Electric Volt. And with a variety of special-edition designs, there‚Äôs a controller that‚Äôll match any gaming setup.

Don't wait--Black Friday deals are here, and these prices won‚Äôt last long. Take advantage now to upgrade your gaming experience for the future online or at your local retailer!
